newsitem.title: GREECE: GREECE EYES ECONOMIC TIES WITH UZBEKISTAN.
newsitem.headline: GREECE EYES ECONOMIC TIES WITH UZBEKISTAN.

text.p: Greece agreed to establish closer economic links with Uzbekistan after prime minister Costas Simitis met with Uzbek president Islam Karimov who is completing an official two-day visit to Athens.

"Greece seeks to strenghten its presence in eastern regions beyond those traditionally established in the wake of World War II, thus participating through its businesses in the economic growth of those states," Simitis said after his meeting with Karimov.
The two country leaders signed a number of agreements on Tuesday, including a double taxation treaty and accords on economic and technological co-operation and human resources training.
